Key Match Events: Jordan Walker went 5-for-5, hitting a long two-run homer in the fifth and driving in three runs
Lars Nootbaar hit a bases-clearing two-strike double in the seventh and added a two-run homer in the ninth
Victor Scott II hit an RBI double and scored on a throwing error by reliever Phil Bickford
Anthony Rizzo hit an RBI double to start a three-run fifth
Alex Verdugo and Gleyber Torres each had run-scoring singles in the fifth
Gleyber Torres lifted a tying sacrifice fly in the sixth
Luken Baker hit a two-run homer in the fourth
Masyn Wynn hit a two-run double in the fourth
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees lost for the fourth time in six games
The Yankees gave up their most hits since allowing 24 to Cleveland on Aug. 15, 2019
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nestor Cortes allowed nine hits, five earned runs in 4.0 innings
JoJo Romero pitched six innings, retiring Soto to end the sixth and set up the big inning for the Cardinals
St. Louis Cardinals set season highs for runs and hits (21) and were 8-for-18 with runners in scoring position
Miles Mikolas allowed five runs (three earned) and seven hits in four-plus innings
The Cardinals were 0-7 in the regular season at Yankee Stadium before winning the final two games of the series
